bib.title: Emotion recognition using wearables: A systematic literature review-work-in-progress
bib.author: Saganowski, Stanis{\l}aw and Dutkowiak, Anna and Dziadek, Adam and Dzie{\.z}yc, Maciej and Komoszy{\'n}ska, Joanna and Michalska, Weronika and Polak, Adam and Ujma, Micha{\l} and Kazienko, Przemys{\l}aw
bib.abstract: Wearables like smartwatches or wrist bands equipped with pervasive sensors enable us to monitor our physiological signals. In this study, we address the question whether they can help us to recognize our emotions in our everyday life for ubiquitous computing. Using the systematic literature review, we identified crucial research steps and discussed the main limitations and problems in the domain.
bib.booktitle: 2020 IEEE International Conference on Pervasive Computing and Communications Workshops (PerCom Workshops)
